title: wilsder
author: wilsder
content: Good morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchange

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Quote from: wilsder on July 10, 2023, 01:16:59 AMGood morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchangeThere are lots of scam p2p traders on the internet so you have to be careful. You can buy from  Bitcointalk marketplace, make sure you’re trading with someone who has a good trust rating and is reputable. Also you can use decentralized exchanges to buy bitcoins, you will not be required to do kyc at any point.  Bisq is one of the most recommended decentralized exchange, you can try using them. I searched for threads that may be helpful to you; List of P2P/no-KYC exchangesHelp: A list of LocalBitcoin alternatives (P2P marketplaces)

comments.author: CryptoHFs
comments.body: Quote from: wilsder on July 10, 2023, 01:16:59 AMGood morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchangeAgoradesk - https://agoradesk.com/

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: It’s a bummer that Localbitcoins isn’t around anymore. I remember when I first got involved with Bitcoin it was very useful. And if you traded with someone with decent feedback you didn’t have to worry about getting any issues.It’s crazy why they decided to implement KYC and then later shut it down. These days people are pretty much forced to use an exchange which is KYC or Bitcoin ATM which has crazy fees.

comments.author: peter0425
comments.body: Quote from: wilsder on July 10, 2023, 01:16:59 AMGood morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchangeYou are already in the best site to sell your bitcoin and that is here in Bitcointalk.org . just try to find trusted account or at least use an Escrow if you are dealing big amount for more safer transaction.there are plenty of good people here that may accept your coins not only bitcoin but even good altcoin as well.the link has been given on the first reply so try to contact one of them and if needed an escrow then visit this section https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=52.0

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: wilsder on July 10, 2023, 01:16:59 AMGood morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchangeYou can exchange bitcoin with some members on this forum. Aside that, you have to make use of an exchange, either decentralized or centralized exchange.You can use decentralized exchange and still be anonymous.On this forum, you can go to currency exchange and see how thingss are there.For a decentralized exchange, you can try Bisq.

comments.author: Minhxx
comments.body: Quote from: wilsder on July 10, 2023, 01:16:59 AMGood morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchangeRight at bitcoincontank you can also buy and sell bitcoin, you just need to find a reputable seller with a high reputation index and good reviews. Be careful scam

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: My friend has recently started using hodlhodl.com and has traded around BTC0.5.QuoteP2P BITCOIN TRADING PLATFORMNon-custodial Bitcoin trading solution, we don’t hold your funds.The key is obviously to DYOR do your own research.On HodlHodl you can trade directly with other users, HodlHodl are the escrow andit would be advisable to trade with trusted users who have a positive track record.The only issue I see from what I'm told is that when a transaction is made HodlHodlrely on the seller to notify them that payment is made so they can release the funds to the buyer.I'm sure it works well and my friend has had zero issues.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: You can trade via Robosats, Hodlhodl, Bisq or Agoradesk.If you're new and don't have any Bitcoin, I recommend to use Agoradesk since it's the most easiest P2P platform.In Bisq you need to have Bitcoin as the deposit or security funds, Robosats you need to use Tor, while Hodlhodl restrict many countries.Quote from: Minhxx on July 10, 2023, 07:27:06 AMRight at bitcoincontank you can also buy and sell bitcoin, you just need to find a reputable seller with a high reputation index and good reviews. Be careful scamWhere is bitcoincontank? if you refer into this forum, you don't have to find a reputable seller. You can either ask him to send first or using a trusted escrow.

comments.author: D ltr
comments.body: Quote from: aoluain on July 10, 2023, 07:31:29 AMMy friend has recently started using hodlhodl.com and has traded around BTC0.5.QuoteP2P BITCOIN TRADING PLATFORMNon-custodial Bitcoin trading solution, we don’t hold your funds.The key is obviously to DYOR do your own research.On HodlHodl you can trade directly with other users, HodlHodl are the escrow andit would be advisable to trade with trusted users who have a positive track record.The only issue I see from what I'm told is that when a transaction is made HodlHodlrely on the seller to notify them that payment is made so they can release the funds to the buyer.I'm sure it works well and my friend has had zero issues.is this the same as p2p on binance, how is the transaction,Do you need KYC when making a transaction?and whether it applies to all countries

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: Quote from: Despairo on July 10, 2023, 07:45:06 AMYou can trade via Robosats, Hodlhodl, Bisq or Agoradesk.If you're new and don't have any Bitcoin, I recommend to use Agoradesk since it's the most easiest P2P platform.In Bisq you need to have Bitcoin as the deposit or security funds, Robosats you need to use Tor, while Hodlhodl restrict many countries.Quote from: Minhxx on July 10, 2023, 07:27:06 AMRight at bitcoincontank you can also buy and sell bitcoin, you just need to find a reputable seller with a high reputation index and good reviews. Be careful scamWhere is bitcoincontank? if you refer into this forum, you don't have to find a reputable seller. You can either ask him to send first or using a trusted escrow.Bisq is good for only Bitcoin and Monero trade as it is on the TOR network, a trader and transactions are completely anonymous. Purchase is possible using local fiat. You would need to download the exchange on your desktop, more details: https://bisq.network/

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Quote from: D ltr on July 10, 2023, 07:53:03 AMis this the same as p2p on binance, how is the transaction,Do you need KYC when making a transaction?and whether it applies to all countriesI never use Binance P2P, assuming Binance P2P ask KYC when you make a transaction, it's mean you're need to verify your account before trading. However in hodlhodl, it seems KYC is mandatory they mention there are two type of accounts. They also not accept all countries. I think the best way is choose the highest score exchange in this site, you can also read the reviews too https://kycnot.me/Quote from: https://accounts.hodlhodl.com/pages/terms_of_serviceyou are not a citizen or tax resident of the United States of America (except if You are using Lend at Hodl Hodl), North Korea, Iraq, Syria, and/or Sudan;Currently, there are two types of accounts - regular account and verified account.“Regular” type of account means that a User who owns this account has only performed standard registration within the Hodlex Ltd authentication system."Verified" type of account means that a User who owns this account has performed the standard registration within the Hodlex Ltd authentication system, and has also entered into an additional agreement with Hodlex Ltd, and has provided all requested identification documents and information and his identity has been verified.

comments.author: retreat
comments.body: Quote from: wilsder on July 10, 2023, 01:16:59 AMGood morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchangeOf course there is. Because from the start Bitcoin was sold P2P and you can find it on Google or my suggestion is you can go directly to the marketplace section of this forum and open your own thread. My advice, if you want to sell your BTC, it's better to use an escrow from a member who has a good reputation, besides your transactions running safely, of course your risk of losing your BTC is much less.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: Hence it is called decentralized exchange a platform that you can buy with P2P without using KYC.There is also talking individually maybe on the forum you can do it, just make a thread on the board that is there then how many bitcoins will be bought by you when there is someone who is interested in the offer then you can make a P2P transaction.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: You can do that here in the forum through the section of Currency exchange.If you're not yet reputable, you have to use an escrow and it's gonna be tough to have a deal that you go first or the other part goes first.To make everything safe, use any from the Recommended bitcointalk escrow services

comments.author: Jating
comments.created_time: July 10, 2023, 11:28:12 AMLast edit: July 10, 2023, 11:52:20 AM by Jating
comments.body: Quote from: wilsder on July 10, 2023, 01:16:59 AMGood morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchangeI guess your really might want to do a face to face transactions? Just be careful though, I would advise just to go to,a. public places, so that there will be a lot of people around b. or better chose a place that has security cameras, just in case.Or go to this board, https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=53.0.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: wilsder on July 10, 2023, 01:16:59 AMGood morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchangeI will advise you to also try to know the current value of what you're selling in terms of reference prize you will be receiving from any buyer in other for you not to be cheated, there's a way some do manipulated the price and make some little changes to adjust to market price, i will advise you always check the current market value before pushing forward, as you've been already advised, take a look at some members of this forum who does that or you make use of a decentralized exchanges as listed from the above link provided to you.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: wilsder on July 10, 2023, 01:16:59 AMGood morning is there a site where you can sell your bitcoins with individuals without going through the exchangeYour question is not so clear, are you looking for a website to sell your BTC's without using a crypto exchange? I don't know if that's what you are looking for, but any platform that you can send your BTC's and receive fiat should be called an exchange, some of them are not so big or popular and operate only in your local region, but they may be risky.If you don't want to trade through an exchange, you have to look for people around you that may be willing to trade BTC's with you in person. Bisq is a decentralized exchange and they can also connect you to traders for face to face trade, it is a safer option to use Bisq's software to arrange in-person trades.

comments.author: Fuso.hp
comments.body: In this case you can do P2P transactions. Binance or kucoin exchange will give you such facility. P2P transaction system is much safer than third party transactions. After making an account in the two exchanges that I have mentioned, verify the exchange. After verifying the account, you will convert the BTC or other currencies that you have, that is, the ones you want to sell to USDT or BTC. After transferring your funds in the P2P section, you can easily sell your BTC or USDT by placing an order of your choice.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Fuso.hp on July 10, 2023, 12:35:55 PMIn this case you can do P2P transactions. Binance or kucoin exchange will give you such facility. P2P transaction system is much safer than third party transactions. After making an account in the two exchanges that I have mentioned, verify the exchange. After verifying the account, you will convert the BTC or other currencies that you have, that is, the ones you want to sell to USDT or BTC. After transferring your funds in the P2P section, you can easily sell your BTC or USDT by placing an order of your choice.That is true, but you are not totally correct. What you are referring to P2P on Binance and Kucoin are not P2P. With P2P (peer-to-peer), there is no intermediary. Binance and Kucoin or the centralized exchange are intermediaries.Second, the OP is asking for direct P2P. Or probably he is going to prefer decentralized exchanges too.
